{{champion:2}} 's rework was more of a gameplay update (his kit stayed pretty much the same, but his abilities' numbers got tweaked), which is still the case for {{champion:69}} , but at the time he just needed a number fix. For a very long time, he was the epitome of everything wrong with bruisers: nearly all of his power was stat- and steroid-based (it still is, to a degree), and his ability to deal massive damage as he built tanky meant that there was no real way to balance him without, well, Olafing him. His greatest strength used to be his personal Atma's Impaler steroid on his W, and after it got removed, he was no longer problematic, even if he was still left in a significantly worse state.

I think he might even need another rework at some point: he's still way too focused on stats and steroids, and buffing him now would perhaps make him more viable, but would still not fix his core issues, that is, a lack of power that is unique to him. His true damage is awesome, and his CC immunity has the potential to let him do things no other champion can, but besides that and his Q slow/poke, everything about him can be itemized for on other champions (by contrast, not even {{champion:11}} can be copied by just buying {{item:3142}}). He deserves to be in a state where he can rampage in teamfights and both take and deal massive damage, and I think his theme as a viking berserker can be emulated with his abilities in a better way than just stat bonuses.

When Olaf was first reworked, I actually remember him being a popular competitive pick. At one point he had 100% pick+ban rate in Korea. This was because his Q slowed a fuckton, then they nerfed it. The rework was needed because he was like a god before (Voyboy's double kill, never forget) and I don't think it "killed" him at all. I wouldn't call him "weak" right now, especially after Righteous Glory came out, he's just not what people are looking for in the toplane given the ranged+mobility meta. He's still one of the best melee duelists and can effectively bully most melees. If the meta ever went back to melees, I think with Righteous Glory he would actually become really good.
